attributes.action: Stop roll out of "Academies" to SEN schools.
attributes.background: Stop rolling out academy schools to SEN Schools. How can a private company do better? It's all about money. How can a shared head teacher have lead in the school? The situation is wrong. The government want to pass schools on, reduce budgets and then blame someone else for the schools doing bad.

attributes.action: Mandatory weekly hour classes in current politics in secondary schools.
attributes.background: Give secondary school children a chance to learn about the different parties in the UK and their policies (etc) from an unbiased perspective. Learn about current affairs both locally and abroad, voting etc. Give everyone the right to unbiased knowledge to make well informed decisions as adults.
attributes.additional_details: I propose hour classes once a week in order to keep children engaged and updated. Teach the requirements for voting, the process of voting, current party policies for each party, practice voting etc. Engage in current debates and learn of foreign affairs that affect both the UK and the world. Allow them the advantage of awareness when coming to the voting age for both fair and thoroughly considered decisions. Studying Holocaust Literature in my degree has inspired me to propose this.

attributes.action: Raise awareness of endometriosis, for all women 18 to 60 +
attributes.background: Raise awareness of endometriosis, for all women 18 to 60 +,men if they know women who are effected. for delivery within professional and public services such as doctors, women's health clinics, to raise awareness of issues faced, treatment by doctors and early detection.
attributes.additional_details: is is important to gain a better understanding of the long term costs and implications to health of those who are effected, awareness of the amount of women affected, hereditary implications and risks associated such as forced hysterectomies, major surgeries and the long term implications to finances and employment of those concerned due to pain and discomfort of symptoms.

attributes.action: Make A levels 3 years. This is to avoid psychological stress for young people.
attributes.background: Governments should take initiative to create this legislation as it would decrease psychological stress for young people.The psychological health of the youth is worrying with many dropping out and wanting to end their lives. We need to support the youth to create a more skilled workforce.
attributes.additional_details:
Today several aspects of young people’s quality of life and lack of well-being in this latest update has increased with over 42 .2% of 16-
19 year old experiencing anxiety which in many cases relates to education. 231 people committed suicide in 2017 due to exam stress while many other attempted to take their own life. We need to help our youth as these are the people of tomorrow. All life is precious so it must be safeguarded by us the people.

attributes.action: Require Schools in England to teach & sing the National Anthem once a week
attributes.background: Only 35% of the UK are proud to be British says a recent poll, this is a giant drop from 10 years ago! Why? The UK with England at it's heart invented the most popular sports. Have legends in Music, Arts, Science, Finance.. Team GB came 2nd at the Olympics!! So let's help regrow the National pride!!
attributes.additional_details: The USA, France and many countries sing their Anthem weekly in schools. Why do we not? We have so much to be proud of. From Yorkshire Puddings to Julie Dench, Mo Farah to Harry Potter. Whether it's Music, Arts, Sports, Commerce or any other possible area England are up there and dominating. Patriotism is falling rapidly, we need to help regrow the passion and allow our children to be taught the Anthem in Schools and to be proud like they should be of the great Country which they are living in.

attributes.action: Give Police more resources to tackle online grooming and the budget required
attributes.background:
We have many paedophile hunting groups trying to tackle this problem 
Protecting our children should be priority number one
attributes.additional_details:
Currently over 100 hunting groups in the UK because the Police don't have the resources
Give Police more resources to tackle online grooming and the budget required
We have Parents taking to the streets in a bid to expose online predators because our current system does not scratch the surface

attributes.action: A Fair Parenting law so that both parents get equal child benefits.
attributes.background: Parents should receive benefits - Child Benefit, Disability Benefit or Carers allowance - for the period their child stays with them.
attributes.additional_details: Parents, particularly disabled parents, need help to feed and clothe their child for the time their children are with them. Parents are having to use food banks because the benefits that should follow the child stay with the resident parent no matter where the child is actually staying.

attributes.action: Raise awareness towards borderline personality disorder (BPD).
attributes.background: Borderline Personality Disorder(BPD) affects people of all ages and it is brought on by previous traumatic experiences that cause/caused instability within someone's life. Those who suffer with BPD don't usually realise until late into adolescents, around 1 in 10 diagnosed end up committing suicide
attributes.additional_details: More awareness and understanding needs to be made available nationally to ensure that this number decreases. This is one of many mental health issues within the UK that is unheard of and for the most part, unknown. Often overlooked as Depression or Anxiety, BPD needs both awareness and more accurate diagnoses. We hope with this petition this can become a reality.

attributes.action: Make selling a new house without building regulation sign-off illegal.
attributes.background: New build houses are being sold without a buildings regulation approval certificate being handed over on completion. Make selling a new build house that has not been signed off by building control illegal and a prosecutable offence.

attributes.action: Make it the law that truck  drivers have air con in their sleeping areas.
attributes.background: My son is a truck driver and he all his colleagues are really feeling unsafe in this heat. Currently company owners do not have to ensure the sleeping area is cooled. There have been reports of cab temperatures reaching in excess of 50 degrees. We wouldn’t do this to a dog, let’s not do it to them

attributes.action: Introduce licence to practice for car mechanics
attributes.background: Anyone can open a motor garage and start working on any vehicles without proper prior knowledge or training. It is now time to deter rogue mechanics to carry out work on motor vehicles without having a licence first. The government should establish a regulatory body for motor mechanics

attributes.action: Make practicing beauty/nail/hairdressing treatments without insurance illegal
attributes.background: There are thousands of unlicensed and uninsured treatments being carried out in beauty every day by untrained people . This puts the public at risk due to various chemicals used and takes business from qualified professionals who have spent years and thousands on training and insurance.
attributes.additional_details: Use of social media has made it easy for untrained freelance therapists, make up artists, technicians and hairdressers to promote themselves to the public who are unaware of the risks they are taking when using these services. Many do not even hold mandatory public liability insurance meaning that any damages or reactions caused by improper use of products and chemicals is uncovered. This puts the public in danger of life-changing deformities by negligence of the persons performing treatments.

attributes.action: Create a single register of eligible voters managed by the Electoral Commission
attributes.background:
Currently local registration offices manage over 350 electoral rolls in the UK.

This petition calls for creation of a single register to be managed by the independent Electoral Commission.

Such a register would help promote public confidence in the democratic process and ensure its integrity.

attributes.action: Children who are registered for home education to have mandatory welfare checks.
attributes.background: When a child is removed from the school roll and registered for home education, there is a loss of the safeguarding layer of that child that teachers and schools currently provide. Parents have no legal obligation to let education department visit the home and determine if a suitable environment.
attributes.additional_details:
Children who are home schooled are at risk of becoming hidden children, with the opportunity to identify risks to their welfare in their home environment severely diminished. 
A simple welfare check on a monthly or quarterly basis would be key to preventing these scenarios.

attributes.action: Government to amend rules so GPs can charge Solicitors for postage for SAR.
attributes.background: GDPR has put a financial burden of £25 for postage on GP Practices for Subject Access Requests (SAR) for litigation cases from Solicitors. Solicitors are capitalising on this as opposed to requesting Access To Medical Records which carries a fee. GP time to remove sensitive data is not recoverable.
attributes.additional_details:
Historically practices could charge up to £50.00 to cover the consumables and postage charges. 
Solicitors are requesting information under a SAR request despite it clearly being for litigation. Patients are consenting to full medical records which under data protection is excessive in line with the Caldecott principals.

attributes.action: Change the voting system to proportional representation, dump FPTP
attributes.background: Proportional representation means that vote share in the population matches the amount of seats each party gets in an election. First past the post creates a huge disparity between vote share and seats in the House of Commons, with parties receiving millions of votes and just one seat. Details below
attributes.additional_details:
2015 Election:

•Conservatives - 331 seats, 11,334,226 votes (36.9%)

•Labour - 232 seats, 9,347,273 votes (30.4%)

•UKIP - 1 seat, 3,881,099votes (12.6%)

•Liberal Democrats - 8 seats, 2,415,916  votes (7.9%)

•Green Party - 1 seat, 1,57,630 votes (3.8%)


2017 Election:

•Conservatives - 318 seats, 13,636,684 votes (42.4%)

•Labour - 262 seats, 12,877,918 votes (40.0%)

•Lib Dems - 12 seats, 2,371,861 votes (7.4%)

•UKIP - 0 seats, 594,068 votes (1.8%)

bbc.co.uk/news/election/2017/results

attributes.action: Introduce law to fine or prosecute the parents of bullies
attributes.background: Bullies have always been a problem in all schools. No action takes place because of their age, therefore they continue to bully. Parents are threatened with fines or prosecution for their child to take too much time off school, surely parents should face the same threat for their child to bully.
attributes.additional_details: Cyber bullying, bullying, threats and ABH, suicide, low self esteem. If parents get fined or threatened with prosecution each time their child bullies another, bullying will become easier to deal with. No child wants their parents to be in trouble, I think this will make the parents more inclined to help stop their child’s bullying behaviour or get help with antibullying classes. Justice for the victims of school bullying. No child deserves to be hurt physically or mentally by their peers.

attributes.action: Introduce sanctions for Whaling nations if the hunting of Whales does not cease.
attributes.background: These countries are hunting a protected species on the pretense they're for scientific research. In reality the Whale meat is for public consumption. The three countries actually trade the meat between themselves despite an international trade ban. Whaling quotas are actually increasing.
attributes.additional_details: Feb 2018 more than 120 pregnant female whales were among 333 killed during Japan’s annual summer hunt in Antarctica. Mar 2018, Norway has announced a 28% increase of its annual whaling quota to 1,278 whales to revive the declining hunt amid international controversy. Jun 2018, Iceland’s whaling season have granted its whalers a quota of 161 fin whales in 2018, compared to 150 in 2017. Jul 2018, Icelandic Whalers kill an endangered Blue Whale...a protected species.

attributes.action: Require drivers over the age of 65 to retake their driving test
attributes.background: As people get older, their reaction times may slow down and their vision may become impaired.

attributes.action: Use the money paid at hospital parkings for the NHS
attributes.background: Hospital parking is so expensive but the public would not begrudge paying it if they knew it would benefit the NHS

attributes.action: Introduce retesting every ten years for drivers/driving license.
attributes.background: Every driver falls into bad habits or are not up to date with the current rules of the road, after driving for years. They put themselves, and others at risk. If we introduce that every driver must re-take their test every ten years, more drivers would be better informed of the rules of the road.
attributes.additional_details:
This would also create more jobs, eg more driving teachers/testers. Every ten years when it’s time to re-take your driving test, the first retake would be free, however, if you fail, you must pay the same cost as your first ever tests.

Also if your main job is driving eg delivery trucks, perhaps the re-take test time should be every 5 years.

All in all this would mean more money for the government, safer drivers with drivers being better informed thus making safer roads.

attributes.action: Employers to allow employees paid time off to attend NHS blood donation
attributes.background: I recently asked to leave work for an hour to attend a local blood donation session and was declined it from a large employer. Allow staff time of work on proof of donation letter to attend local blood donation sessions to help save lives

attributes.action: All Diabetes sufferers should be entitled to free dental treatment
attributes.background: I was diagnosed with Type II Diabetes in 2016. I hadn't required any dental treatment for over 10 years but suddenly felt that my gums were receding. The dentist later told me that diabetic people are very prone to gum disease. Besides free eye tests and feet checks, dental care should be included.
attributes.additional_details:
People with diabetes are at greater risk for dental problems.

They're more likely to have infections of their gums and the bones that hold their teeth in place, because diabetes can reduce the blood supply to the gums.

High blood sugar may also cause dry mouth and make gum disease worse. Less saliva can allow more tooth-decaying bacteria and plaque buildup.

attributes.action: Ban Smart Meters
attributes.background: There have been concerns about their effect on people’s health, along with the way that they could invade your privacy, and in the end they cost way more compared to an old type of meter.

attributes.action: Abolish International Student Fees and Finance Ineligibility for UK Citizens
attributes.background: The prerequisite three year residence in the UK deprives British citizens from the ability to access Student Finance, meaning that families have to attempt to pay the massive fees on their own. This disadvantages domestic students, and is unfair on those who possess British passports and citizenship
attributes.additional_details: I moved back to the UK from overseas in June 2017, and wish to apply for university in 2019, once I have completed A Levels. I was born in Kings-Lynn, Norfolk, and have possessed a British passport all my life. Having never lived under another nationality, or been a permanent resident of any foreign country, to find out that I am classed as an international student within my own borders is upsetting, and is a disadvantage for me, as I now cannot afford higher education, or find myself a job.

attributes.action: Increase organ donation by asking GP's to discuss the issue with their patients.
attributes.background:
I would like to raise awareness for organ donation to help those currently awaiting a transplant. At present, GP's do not ask patients whether they have ever considered donating their organs. 
I would like GP's to ask patients about organ donation as part of their routine medical appointments.
attributes.additional_details:
Over 7000 people are currently on the organ donation register awaiting a chance to improve their health and well-being. I am trying to increase awareness of the importance of organ donation across the UK and break down the stigma of having this crucial conversation. 
GP's play a vital role within our communities and have a close professional relationship with their patients, where discussions may be held freely. Please support my campaign to increase awareness and enrolment for organ donation.

attributes.action: Abolish the Dangerous Dogs Act 1991
attributes.background: Thousands of unwanted dogs (primarily Pitbulls) are put down because of the Dangerous Dogs Act which makes it illegal for breeds which are classified as 'dangerous' to be rehomed to a loving owner and have to be euthanized if they become unwanted by their original owner.

attributes.action: Raise the stamp duty on second homes and onwards to 50% to fund home building.
attributes.background: House prices are too high for first time buyers. Funds raised by stamp duty on second homes can be used to build new affordable homes.

attributes.action: New high speed rail link parkway station for Maidstone
attributes.background: The HS1 link bypasses Maidstone and the town is at a disadvantage to other Kent towns in investment and travel provision. A new parkway station could be accessed from the A229 and would serve both Maidstone and the surrounding towns. There should have been a station when it was first developed.
attributes.additional_details: The HS1 high speed rail line runs north of Maidstone, providing faster travel links to Ebbslfeet and Ashford as well as towns further away such as Canterbury and Margate, but the County Town receives no benefit. Investment in Ashford and Ebbsfleet is significantly greater than Maidstone and the town still suffers from a poor and very slow train service to London compared to other towns outside of London. It takes twice as long to reach London from Maidstone than from Ashford which is ridiculous.

attributes.action: Ban alcohol and gambling sponsors in sport.
attributes.background:
Our nation is getting worse with alcohol and gambling, young children, teens are being exposed to bad influences that it is good to drink alcohol and gamble as it is good to watch sport such as football. Children are seeing this as a norm and have become addicts.
It is time to stop this.

attributes.action: Offer more funding to suicide and self-harm charities.
attributes.background: The rates of suicide and self-harm cases are extremely alarming in present day. Whilst there are charitable organisations trying to combat these issues, there is more than can be done. With the digital age that we currently live in, more can be done to ensure that these charities are being utilised.
attributes.additional_details: Potentially, phone companies being required to install these numbers in people's phone books, mandatory app's with the information. The help is there, but people need to know it's there.

attributes.action: Public enquiry into new 2018 train timetables' severe delays and cancellations
attributes.background: Since the introduction of new train timetables in May 2018, services by multiple train opertators have been serverely affected daily delays and cancellations. Poor forward planning by operators has caused unacceptable inconvenience, loss of earnings and damage to regional and national economies.

attributes.action: Allow the NHS to accept financial donations at a national level
attributes.background: There's one thing everyone agrees on in the UK, everyone values the NHS. The incredible impact from NHS staff is felt by family and friends near and far. Yet while the Government discusses blanket tax rises, they fail to recognise the easiest route to raising cash, through voluntary donations.
attributes.additional_details:
Currently, it is possible to donate to small pockets of the NHS, mainly NHS Trusts, however, this doesn't go far enough and it's pretty hard to access. 

In 2017, the RNLI raised £196m (this figure grows year on year) through fundraising, imagine if the NHS created a central pot to accept donations.

attributes.action: Change the law so that all food sold in stores has allergy labels
attributes.background: Food such as bakery items made in store that are left on the shelf for consumers to buy do not have to have allergen information. The stores cover themselves by having a small sign on shelf to imply the risk of contamination or ingredients, but the item itself doesn’t contain any such information.
attributes.additional_details: A family member purchased a bakery item and gave it to my child. One hour after eating, my son passed out from an allergic reaction. Had the label clearly showed the ingredients, this could have been avoided. This could have been so much worse had it been another child/person. I want allergy info on all food items.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for prisoners to share a cell.
attributes.background:
Prison is a very stressful and violent environment. People are placed there to be so called "reabilitated'.
In order for a prisoner to progress, inmates should not have to endure the added suffering that is to share a cell.
How would you feel if you had to go to the toilet in front of a stranger.
attributes.additional_details:
I understand prison is place for people who broke the law but prison nowadays are full of people suffering from mental health issues who should not be there in the first place.
Prisons are the new "Asylums" and inmates suffering from mental health issues are particularly vulnerable in a cell sharing scenario.
Prison is about the loss of freedom, not suffering further torture while inside one.

attributes.action: Debt agencies should only charge a small percentage fee for recovery of any debt
attributes.background: Companies and debt agencies should only be allowed to charge a very small percentage fee for any recovery of debts.
attributes.additional_details: Debt is a nationwide epidemic, companies and debt agencies have been exploiting people’s financial difficulties, and charging excessive amounts of money to recover any debt, often pushing people into further debt, and even bankruptcies and/or debt relief orders. Writing people off financially for years and sometimes preventing them from ever getting back on there financial feet again. Debt is a very stressful, experience causing anxiety, depression and even suicides. It’s time to change the la !

attributes.action: Refund 50% of 2018 car tax to offset the cost to Motorists and Motorbike Riders
attributes.background:
Due to the Extreme weather conditions 
The UK Roads are at their worst condition for years and are filled with potholes and loose chipping that are causing untold damage to suspension and tyres. This heavy cost of repair is a burden. Councils have not carried out repairs so a refund should assist

attributes.action: Make it illegal to have alcohol at school events in which children are present.
attributes.background: Alcohol plays far too big a part in society as it is. Alcohol is a grown up thing that children should not be part of. By having alcohol at children's school events we are not only weakening the safeguarding of the children attending, but also showing them that we drink to have a good time.
attributes.additional_details:
Adults should be leading by good example. You can't teach responsible drinking while drinking in front of them. It should be respected that there are parents that want to raise their children in alcohol free environments. 
1 in 5 children are affected by a parents drinking this also needs to be taken into consideration, for some of those children school is a safe and fun environment. 
There is no argument for alcohol at schools, other than "we want it" However there are many disadvantages to it.

attributes.action: Remove all benefit caps on Kinship/sgo carers
attributes.background: Across the country kinship carer are struggling because of benefit caps leaving most of them worse off than they would be if they never took on these children. It would cost more to keep them in care make payments to these wonderful people more inline  with foster carers or please  remove the caps.

attributes.action: Fund free travel on public transport for all students in England.
attributes.background: Students do not earn money and yet have to pay for travel. This is not fair and many cannot afford it. Students are normally travelling to school/ college and shouldn't have to pay for this. This is why we feel that all students should have free travel and we urge you to sign it.

attributes.action: Require all businesses who sell food to provide dairy alternatives
attributes.background: A growing number of children are being daignosed with dairy intolerance. Wouldn't it be nice to stop at your local ice cream parlour and be able to buy a dairy alternative ice cream or take your diary intolerant child out for a milkshake at any cafe without having to check with them first?
attributes.additional_details: Seems such a small thing but trying to explain to a little boy he can't have an ice cream on the seafront but the other children can is heart breaking. I believe it's about time businesses were forced to supply an alternative to dairy to meet the growing needs of intolerant children and adults.

attributes.action: Automatic British Citizenship for Indefinite Leave to Remainers settled 15 years
attributes.background: My parents immigrated to the UK with my sister and I in 1988. I obtained ILR status in 2001 having lived in the U.K. since aged 2, gone to university and worked here all my life. It’s not fair to have to sit a test and pay £1330 to become Naturalised. Britain has been my home all my life.
attributes.additional_details: I am 31 years old. I have lived in the U.K. for 29 years.  I have had ILR status since 2001 (for 17 years). It is not fair to have to sit a life in the UK test and pay £1330 to become naturalised. I’ve gone to nursery, primary school, secondary school and  University and spent my whole working life in the U.K. The Government even recognise my 9 month old daughter as British so why do I have to pay over the odds when I pay tax and national insurance and have done my whole working life!

attributes.action: Make basic equality training a legal requirement for businesses
attributes.background: The equality act 2010 is a wonderful piece of legislation that protects people from discrimination.
attributes.additional_details: If you've ever been treated unfairly due to your disability, age, race or gender, it is there to protect you but what happens when someone or a company does it and refuses to change? Nothing a lot of the time and it's not right! People and companies need to be educated on the equality act and make reasonable adjustments where necessary.

attributes.action: Make the Department for Education invest £1.3 billion pounds in schools
attributes.background:
I am a student and the reason why I started this petition is because the education budget cuts had a devastating effect on my school and other schools in London.

If you sign this petition you are supporting my plea to make the government invest £1.3 billion pounds in schools.
attributes.additional_details: If you sign this petition you are supporting my plea to make the government to invest £1.3billion pounds in schools

attributes.action: Change the law to ensure that NICE guidance outweighs the "Bolam Test"
attributes.background: I have suffered a heart attack which left me disabled. I allege this was due to sub-standard practices. However, solicitors say that my case would not meet the 'Bolam Test', in that, if a similar expert would have 'done the same thing' then a claim will fail even if NICE guidance has been ignored.
attributes.additional_details:
Nice Guidance states that “If you currently have chest pain ... you may need to go to hospital as an emergency ... if you do not currently have chest pain and your ECG was normal … you should have an assessment in hospital on the same day" 
(Solicitor's response - below) 
".. NICE guidelines are recommendations ... advice they provide should not be compared to .. many years of professional experience".

attributes.action: Repair pot holed roads by introduction of vignette system for foreign drivers
attributes.background: Many countries in Europe make road users pay to use motorways and major roads, either by way of tolls or a vignette system. I propose introducing a Vignette system in the UK for foreign drivers which would raise revenue to be shared amongst the counties and used solely for repairing road surfaces.
attributes.additional_details: Pot holes in UK roads are increasing due to councils lack of funds for repairs. This causes serious safety issues for drivers and cyclists and can cause major damage to vehicles.

attributes.action: Start charging for non-emergencies in A & E across the U.K
attributes.background:
There are too many people wasting Doctors time & resources in 
A & E Departments across the U.K. I think these non-emergencies should be charged for time wasting when these people could have gone to their GP or pharmacist to get sorted. The monies collected should then be put back into the system.

attributes.action: Ban the production and sale of non-recycled toilet paper in this country.
attributes.background: All of us use toilet paper every day.  Has it ever occurred to you that most toilet paper is made from new trees?  Recycled toilet paper is not widely available in shops in this country.  It should be the only option available because of the huge negative impact it has on the environment.
attributes.additional_details:
Here are some facts (http://www.theworldcounts.com/counters/how_consumerism_affects_the_environment/toilet_paper_environmental_impact):

- The toilet paper we use could go around the planet every 2 minutes, or travel to the sun and back every 10 days.

- The difference between using new toilet paper and toilet paper made from recycled materials is 400 million trees, 660 million tons of water, and 45 million tons of oil.

attributes.action: Public enquiry into child sexual abuse and exportation in Cleveland
attributes.background: Cleveland police have investigated child sexual abuse and exploitation with little result. I believe many more people should have been charged and many people were too scared to come forward. The impact of this has devastated many people and even led to drug and alcohol problems.

attributes.action: All EU powers should return to Scotland, Wales and Northern Ireland after Brexit
attributes.background: The UK government is saying that they need to reserve some powers after Brexit to protect the UK single market.  But that’s not necessarily true.  What they’re proposing would actually damage the UK and the UK single market.  So I call on the UK to automatically devolve all of these EU powers.
attributes.additional_details: Devolving all these powers would might prevent the break up of the UK.  Whereas, what the UK government is proposing would actually break Britain up.  So I would like to see a cross-party discussion on this.
